intro: Coluteastrum abbreviatum, commonly known as the dwarf bladderflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, hairy leaves and distinctive bladder-like seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Coluteastrum abbreviatum is often found in rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
